result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John B. Cook

defendant.name: Cook, John B.
defendant.address: 30 North 3rd St., c/o Jackson County Jail, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John B. Cook
Current: 30 North 3rd St., c/o Jackson County Jail, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2016)
Prior: 300 Stacy Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Sebion.  Case in front of Judge Becker is pending.  Attorney Sebion requests that these cases track.  STC in 60 days.  Schedule with Judge Goodman's JA.

No appearance by defendant.  SPD Carly Sebion appears on her client's behalf.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Judge Goodman states he is aware of other pending case with Judge Becker.  These cases will be reviewed in 60 days - all set for status on July 21 at 3:00.

Attorney SPD Sebion appears by phone.  Defendant is not present.  Gerald Fox is present for the State.  Case #15CF83 is in front of Judge Becker.  Will get a scheduling order in place for that case soon.  Set for another phone status a couple of months out.  Court will schedule another status in 60 days.  His J.A. will schedule.
Per Judge Goodman's office.  STC on 10/2 removed.  Will wait until after 10/13 arraignment in Judge Becker's case to set.

Covers 12CF164, 12CF70, 14CF93, and 15CF26. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Not to associate with any know drug users or dealers.  Not to be illegal drugs are used or sold.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: victim Zachary K. and co-defendants: Brandon L. and minor Z. A.  Must reside with his parents on Chestnut Street, in Black River Falls, WI.  Be at the residence at all times, except for court and legal appointments, job interviews or employment, and treatment.

Held by phone in Monroe County.  Clerk:  MM from Judge Goodman's office.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State by telephone.   Attorney Sebion appeared on behalf of the defendant, by phone.  Defense is agreeable with taking the offer made by the State.  Schedule plea hearing.  PSI will be reqeusted.  Plea set for 6/5/15 at 9:30 am for 1/2 hour.

SPD Carly Sebion appeared on behalf of her client.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Judge Goodman appeared by phone from Monroe County.  DA Fox states he has given his final offer to attorney Sebion and she needs to still talk to her client.  Court set a phone status conference for 4-22-15 at 8:30.  DA Fox is to initiate the call to Judge Goodman.
of NASJ.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  UTF.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Sebion.  Parties are working on a resolution.  15CF26 just assigned to Judge Goodman.  Attorney Sebion requests that the bond be lowered.  DA Fox opposes.  Bond continued as previously ordered.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Arraignment to be set in front of new judge.

Defendant now appears in person.  Other appearance as before.   Court questions defendant on his understanding of waiving his preliminary hearing.  Defendant understands waiver.  Court finds that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.

DA fOX appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.   Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Reading of complaint waived.  Attorney Sebion says that defendant wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.  Defendant to appear later this afternoon.

Be at the residence at all times, except for court and legal appointments, job interviews or employment, and treatment.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with no counsel present.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant has received complaint but has not contacted the SPDO yet.  He states he already has Carly Sebion on othere cases.  Judge tells him he must re-apply with SPD.  Court sets $750 cash bond with same conditions as other pending cases.
